fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence government spreading fuel shortage rumours to sell surplus
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s been claimed the government spread fuel shortage lies to sell a surplus which was about to expire. There is no evidence of this.

fact_check_explanation_title: How many more HGV drivers does the UK need?
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s been claimed that the UK is short 100,000 HGV drivers, but the government has reportedly said we only need another 30,000.

fact_check_explanation_title: Woman filling bags with petrol was not filmed in south London
fact_check_explanation_summary: A tweet falsely claims that a woman was filmed filling plastic bags full of petrol at an Esso forecourt in Tooting.

fact_check_explanation_title: We do know that Covid-19 vaccines work
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video of Bill Gates saying we don’t know whether vaccines work comes from July 2020, when the results of the Covid-19 vaccine trials had not yet been published.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ethylene oxide-sterilised swabs won’t cause harm during pregnancy
fact_check_explanation_summary: A PHE document on ethylene oxide exposure is not talking about the limited exposure you get from using sterilised swabs, which are extremely unlikely to have any of the chemical …

fact_check_explanation_title: Chevening isn’t 'taxpayer-funded' in the usual sense
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s paid for by a public trust—but that trust is exempt from income tax and appears to have received at least some taxpayer money in the past.

fact_check_explanation_title: Red Cross hasn’t banned blood donation from vaccinated people
fact_check_explanation_summary: The American Red Cross has stopped taking donations of blood plasma containing antibodies as it has enough supply.

fact_check_explanation_title: Citric acid is not being used by ‘evil forces’ to harm population
fact_check_explanation_summary: Manufactured citric acid is one of the most common food additives in the world.

fact_check_explanation_title: Has Brexit caused higher gas prices?
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are a number of factors at play but leaving the Internal Energy Market is unlikely to be a significant one.

fact_check_explanation_title: Figures about Pfizer side effects for children need more context
fact_check_explanation_summary: 86% of 12 to 15 year-olds reported a sore arm after vaccination.
A Facebook post wrongly suggests that all bumblebees are endangered.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pregnancy tests can’t reliably diagnose testicular cancer
fact_check_explanation_summary: Over-the-counter pregnancy tests detect high levels of a hormone sometimes associated with testicular cancer, but this doesn’t mean they can be used to identify the disease.
